meta_description: Official website of the Charles M. Schulz Museum and Research Center located in Santa Rosa, California.
hours_text:
## 

## Address

2301 Hardies Lane  
Santa Rosa, California 95403

[(707) 579-4452](tel:+17075794452)  
[inquiries@schulzmuseum.org](mailto:inquiries@schulzmuseum.org)

[GET DIRECTIONS](/visit/directions)

### [Museum Hours](/visit/hours-and-admission)

  * Monday: 11:00 am–5:00 pm
  * Tuesday: **Closed**
  * Wednesday: 11:00 am–5:00 pm
  * Thursday: 11:00 am–5:00 pm
  * Friday: 11:00 am–5:00 pm
  * Saturday: 10:00 am–5:00 pm
  * Sunday: 10:00 am–5:00 pm

**The Museum is closed on Tuesdays year-round.**

**Holiday Closures:** The Museum is closed on New Year’s Day; Easter Sunday; Fourth of July; Thanksgiving Day; Christmas Eve Day; and Christmas Day.

### [Museum Admission](/visit/hours-and-admission)

Admission tickets are available for purchase upon arrival. The Museum does not offer pre-sale admission tickets.

  * Members — FREE
  * Adults — $15
  * Seniors (62 and over) — $10
  * Students (with valid student ID) — $7
  * Youth (4-18) — $7
  * Children (3 and under) — FREE
  * EBT Cardholders (with card; up to 4 people) — $4
  * Military — $1 off admission

### [Frequently Asked Questions](https://schulzmuseum.org/about-schulz/frequently-asked-questions/)

What should you know before you arrive? Get the details in this list of common questions.

### [Accessibility](https://schulzmuseum.org/visit/accessibility/)

The Charles M. Schulz Museum and Research Center is for everyone to enjoy! Find out about our accessibility services.

accessibility_text:
The Charles M. Schulz Museum and Research Center is for everyone to enjoy! Please read about our accessibility services below.

## Getting Around the Museum

* * *

The Museum’s front entrance and all of the Museum’s galleries are wheelchair accessible. Please use the elevator located between the downstairs accessible restrooms to view the second-floor galleries. View [Museum Map.](https://schulzmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/SchulzMuseumMap_General.pdf)

## Access Features

* * *

#### Visitors Who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing

**American Sign Language (ASL) Interpretation**

ASL interpretation is provided at no additional fee for all public programs, lectures, and docent-led tours when reserved in advance. Regular Museum fees for these programs still apply.

There is a $50.00 minimum for all private docent-led Museum tours. Fees and minimums for docent-led tours are detailed on our Group Tours webpages [**here**](https://schulzmuseum.org/visit/adult-tours/). ASL interpretation can be added at no additional charge. Regular tour fees, including the $50.00 minimum, still apply.

To request ASL interpretation for a program or event, or to reserve an ASL interpreted docent-led tour for a $50.00 minimum, please fill out the [tour request form](https://schulzmuseum.org/accessible-tour-request/) at least three weeks in advance of your visit

**Assistive Listening Devices**
